strIntroduction: This tour offers you round-trip bullet train Shinkansen tickets departing from Nagoya to Kyoto and one night accommodation at Kyoto's hotel. You will depart from Nagoya Station to Kyoto Station by Shinkanen bullet train in the morning, and explore Kyoto’s historical places and experience the culture of Kyoto for the rest of the day. For the second day, you will depart from Kyoto Station to Nagoya Station with the Shinkansen bullet train in the early evening, so you will have more time for sightseeing and shopping in Kyoto during the day. Some of Kyoto Hotels available to book are as follows: - Karasuma Kyoto Hotel 2016 - New Miyako Hotel 2016 - Gion Yoshi-ima 2016 We will inform you which hotel is available after you make your reservation. Some famous sightseeing spots for Kyoto are as follows: - Kinkakuji Temple Kinkakuji, the famed “Golden Pavilion,” is Kyoto’s most iconic sight, rising above its reflecting pond like an apparition, - Ginkakuji Temple Ginkakuji temple, the “Silver Pavilion”, has magnificent halls and gardens, with a tremendous viewpoint over the entire temple compound - Kiyomizu-dera Temple Kiyomizu-dera Temple is one of Kyoto’s must-see attractions. It’s a bustling riot of commerce and schlock, but it’s a lot of fun, especially for the kids. - Nijo Castle Nijo Castle is one of Kyoto’s most popular and impressive sights. It shows the power that the Shoguns wielded over the emperors throughout the Edo Period The itinerary for this tour is as follow: Day 1 7:00 – 9:50 Depart from Nagoya by Shinkansen (reserved seat) The Shinkansen train time indicated on your ticket cannot be changed 07:50 – 10:40 Arrive in Kyoto Station Enjoy a self-guided tour in Kyoto and check-in to the hotel Day 2 Breakfast at the Hotel Free time until departure. 18:50 – 20:30 Depart from Kyoto Station to Nagoya Station with Kodama Shinkansen (reserved seat) 19:40 – 21:30 Tour ends at Nagoya Station
strTitle: 2 Days Nagoya/Kyoto bullet train and 1 night stay in Kyoto!

strIntroduction: This is a forest therapy tour by tractor where visitors can see the historical Koiwai Farm in Iwate prefecture. Explore and relax in the greenery of green paradise! Koiwai Farm was opened in 1891 and is one of the most historical dairy products maker in Japan. They offer this tour to show and tell the guests how exciting the “dairy farming, forestry, service” are. The total farm space is approx. 3000 ha, which is twice as big as Haneda Airport. Koiwai Farm has been working continuously on forestry. They’ve been taking care of each afforestation for more than 100 years and are handing the practice down to the younger generation. In this tour, you can ride on the tractor bus and explore the impressive and relaxing atmosphere of this forest. There will be a tour guide who works at the farm and the guide will tell us stories about the animals living in the forest. Since this forest in Koiwai Farm has an original ecosystem, you may be able to see some endangered species and rare biodiversity. The scenery of the forest will change every season, so you will never get the same tour twice. We recommend this tour to guests who are interested in attending academic tours such as visiting museums or guests who love to take photos! There are many photo shooting spots to enjoy the seasonal scenery of Koiwai Farm. Also, great for those who enjoy relaxing the great outdoors! Join this exciting nature tour where you can not only see the impressive view of grassland but also visit the forest that has more than 100 years of history! This tour is available during April 15th to November 6th. Itinerary: Meet your guide in front of the tractor station at Makibaen in Koiwai Farm ※You have 5 options for the meeting time. 10:00 / 11:00 / 14:00 / 15:00 13:00 (Only on Saturdays, Sundays, national holidays) This tour ends at the point of departure.
strTitle: Enjoy Wonderful Nature with Tractor Bus Tour in Iwate!

strIntroduction: The is a historical bus tour where you can explore Koiwai Farm guided by amazing staff actually working on the farm. Many places are usually not open for visitors, so don't miss this opportunity to uncover the hidden secrets a farm with over 120 years of history! Koiwai Farm was opened in 1891 and is one of the most historical dairy products maker in Japan. They offer this tour to show and tell the guests how exciting the “dairy farming, forestry, service” are. The total farm space is approx. 3000 ha, which is twice as big as Haneda Airport. The tour guide will introduce Koiwai Farm’s history, what kind of things they’re doing, scenery from the farm, and more with their official uniform which continues to be worn from the Meiji era. The staff at Koiwai Farms work using traditional methods while also implementing environmentally innovative initiatives. Moreover, it is a great chance to see a sustainable forest which is very rare in Japan. It is an exciting tour where you can see a “real” farm and feel the atmosphere of the active livestock business! We recommend this tour to guests who are interested in attending academic tours such as visiting museums or guests who love to take photos! There are many photo shooting spots to enjoy the seasonal scenery of Koiwai Farm. This tour is available during April 15th to November 6th. Itinerary: Meet your guide in front of the set up tent at Makibaen in Koiwai Farm ※You have 4 options for the meeting time. 09:30 / 11:00 / 13:00 / 14:30 You will visit: -Main Office -Old Amihari Highway -Warehouse -Tsurugadai Cowshed -Biomass Power “Shizuku-ishi” -Natural Refrigerator -Kamimaru Cowshed -See the only cherry blossom tree in Koiwai Farm -Bushes of Koiwai Farm This tour ends at the point of departure.
strTitle: Enjoy Guided Bus Tour of Koiwai Farm in Iwate, Tohoku!

strIntroduction: In this activity organized by “Classical Princess Japon”, you can try on a Classic Kimono Dress and feel yourself transform into a gorgeous and elegant princess. You can truly see your beauty and grace personified in the photos. Classical Princess Japon focuses on bustle dresses (classical dresses) from the Meiji Era and successfully created their own original bustle dresses made of antique kimono fabrics. Their mission is to help guests explore the fusion of Japanese and foreign culture. You are able to select one of three places for your photoshoot. Firstly, The Osaragi Jiro Memorial Museum. Osaragi Jiro(1897-1973) was a novelist born in Yokohama, Kanagawa, and in this memorial museum you can see his products and many other historical documents. It is located near the park where you can see the Yokohama port The arch-shaped roof with the exterior of red brick is very outstanding. Secondly, Yokohama Red Brick Warehouse No.1. It is one of the most popular tourist spots in Yokohama, which is a cultural and commercial facility that utilizes two historical buildings constructed more than a century ago. The building contains cafes, restaurants, and shops. Seasonal events are often held there. Thirdly, Buildings of Yamate-Seiyokan. Yamate-Seiyokan. There are 7 western-style buildings that have a long history. This tour is available everyday.
strTitle: Wear a Traditional Kimono and Do a Photoshoot in Kanagawa!

strIntroduction: This is a fascinating nature tour in the Ogasawara Islands, Tokyo where a guide will take you to the sea to meet whales. The Ogasawara Islands are a part of Tokyo and a World Nature heritage location and this tour will be held around one of the Islands called Chichijima, which is a 25 hours ferry trip from Tokyo. Unfortunately the ferry only runs once a week, but it is well worth visiting this place if you are a great fan of nature. Whale Watching Humpback whales and Sperm whales raise and nurture their young in the waters of the Ogasawara Islands giving you a great chance to get close to these magnificent mammals. See them breach, spout, tail slap and play. The tour schedule is as below and you can choose from morning or afternoon. A. Morning plan 8:15- 12:00 08:15-08:30 Meet up at Experience Meeting Point or Pick-up from your accommodation in Chichijima B. Afternoon plan 11:45- 15:00 11:45-12:00 Meet up at Experience Meeting Point or Pick-up from your accommodation in Chichijima About Pick-up Service If your accommodation is located further than Sakaiura, your pick up time will be 15 minutes earlier. Pick-up: You can choose either Pick-up or Check-in (free). Optional: Rental snorkeling gear + 1,000 JPY Mask, snorkel and fins Rental wetsuit + 1,000 JPY Prescription goggles + 500 JPY Fins only + 500 JPY
strTitle: Enjoy Half Day Whale Watching in the Sea of Ogasawara

strIntroduction: In this tour, you will be able to experience an interesting adventure in an Okutama limestone-cave. You only need to bring your own athletic shoes, some towels, and most importantly an adventurous spirit! Caving equipment is included in the price. The instructor has more than 20 years of caving experience, and also has instructing experience for other outdoor sports such as diving. You will be able to pace yourself and enjoy the exploration! Stalactites take around 200 years to grow down and take around 400 years to grow up. How about enjoying this beautiful nature in Tokyo? Pick-up and drop-off are available at the following stations on this tour: Nakano Station / Shibuya Station / Shinjuku Station / Your preferred station in Tokyo Schedule: 06:00-06:30 Pick-up from Shinjuku, Shibuya, Nakano, or requested stations (Time will change) 10:00 Arrival 10:30 Change Clothes 10:45 Enter the cave 12:30 Return and change clothes 12:50 "Moegi-no-yu" hot spring (optional) 13:20 Lunch 17:00 Drop-off at Shinjuku, Shibuya, Nakano, or requested stations (Time is just an aim) *Age 5 or under CANNOT attend this tour.

strIntroduction: The Ogasawara Islands are located in the North-Western Pacific Ocean roughly 1,000 km south of Tokyo and have a rare variety of plants and animals including more than 440 species of native vascular plants. They are also the habitat for more than 100 recorded native land snail species. The islands were formed by the protrusions of an ancient underwater volcano. Chichijima (Chichi Island) in the Ogasawara archipelago is regarded as the main Island and the entrance to the Ogasawara Islands area. It will take about 25 hours from Tokyo Bay by regular passenger ship which operates once in 6 days during the winter and once in 3 days in the peak season. There are world-class of diving spots in Ogasawara Islands and most of the snorkeling spots are in clear blue water allowing for viewing the colorful coral leafs and a dynamic variety of fish. On this snorkeling tour there will be a lot of points that will excite you, such as the experience of floating in the sea, chasing beautiful fish, seeing a sunken ship and more. Wearing only snorkeling gear, you can have a great experience in the undersea world of the Ogasawara Islands with an experienced instructors's guidance. If it is your first time to try snorkeling the professional instructor will give you a beginner's lesson so you don't need to worry! Schedule: -Morning course: 08:00- 08:30 Meet at Take Nature Academy or Pick-up from your accommodation in Chichijima 08:30 Check in for the tour at Take Nature Academy Snorkeling for around 2 - 3 hours 12:00 Check out from the tour at Take Nature Academy -Afternoon course: 11:30- 12:00 Meet at Take Nature Academy or Pick-up from your accommodation in Chichijima 12:00 Check in for the tour at Take Nature Academy Snorkeling for around 2 - 3 hours 15:30 Check out from the tour at Take Nature Academy
strTitle: Enjoy Wonderful Snorkeling in the Ogasawara Islands!

strIntroduction: Osaka, a large port city and commercial center Japan's Main Island of Honshu and is known for its modern architecture, boisterous nightlife and hearty street food. Originally named "Naniwa," Osaka was the capital of Japan from 683 to 745 and remained an important hub for land, sea, and river-canal transportation even after the capital moved. This is a one day trip from Osaka Station to walk through Umeda district, Osaka Castle, together with a river cruise. 07:45 - 08:35 Pick up from selected Kyoto hotels Aerial Garden observatory and Umeda District (60 minutes) Located on the 40th floor, this floating garden spans the rooftops of two buildings, providing amazing 360 degree views of Osaka. Lunch at Hotel Granvia Osaka ( 50 minutes) Osaka Castle ( 60 minutes） Standing on a stone platform, this magnificent castle towering over the city, was founded in the16th century by Hideyoshi Toyotomi. A remarkable shogun of the Sengoku period, the castle is known as the symbol of his power. Osaka Aqua Liner (60 minutes) Enjoy a 60 minute river cruise with views of Osaka Castle, the Twin Towers, Nakanoshima Island, and much more. Osaka Station to Kyoto Station (30 minutes) 17:00 - 17:30 Tour ends upon arrival at Kyoto Station
strTitle: Enjoy 1-Day Osaka Walking Tour from Kyoto

strIntroduction: This activity is held in the rural south part of Fukuoka prefecture, about 45-60 minutes by train from Fukuoka city. strIntroduction: Minamijima (Minami Island ) is an uninhabited Island located about one kilometer southwest of Chichijima island, the largest island in the Ogasawara archipelago. The only way to reach the Ogasawara islands is by taking a 25 hours and a half long ferry ride from Tokyo covering a distance of over 1,000 kilometers. It takes approx. 20 mins by boat from Chichijima island's Futami Harbor to Minami Island and 1.5 hours by sea kayak from Kominato Coast. Minami Island has a submerged karst terrain and is a geologically valuable Island, surrounded by a beautiful white sand beach and rocky cliffs. The white sand beach is covered with snail shell fossils, which give it a very charming atmosphere. In Minami Island, there are many indigenous animals and plants such as the Coenobita crab, an endangered species. From May to September, during the spawning season of the green sea turtle, it is possible to see the baby turtles after they hatch from their eggs. Minami Island is home to a variety of sea birds as well, so you might be able to spot chicks around June and empty nests on the ground. To protect Minami island's ecosystem, only 100 visitors are allowed to enter each day for a maximum of two hours and accompanied by a licensed local guide. The visit of the island involves some climbing through rocky terrain, however, the stunning view that will be awaiting you at the top will surely become an unforgettable memory. The Morning tour will pick you up at 8:15 at your accommodation in Chichijima island and depart at 8:30 from Take Nature Academy, finishing at 11:30; while the afternoon tour will pick you up at 12:45 at your accommodation and depart at 13:00 from Take Nature Academy, returning at 16:00.
strTitle: Visit the beautiful Minami Island in the Ogasawara Islands!

strIntroduction: In this tour you can stay at a gorgeous tent and enjoy the beautiful nature at the same time! You won't believe it's a tent! It features beds, a sofa, a table and even electric power. It's a new style of outdoor leisure, known as glamping. The idea is to relax under the beautiful stars and enjoy nature in a comfortable way. By staying at Twin Ring Motegi, you'll discover a new side of nature. You'll get to know many kinds of creatures and plants in the forest around you and experience the change of seasons. Among the many attractions, there's a 561 meter long "Zip Line" that will let you soar above the forest. It is so much fun that not only children but also adults will enjoy this attraction to the fullest. This is one of the longest zip-lines in Japan. This tour also includes a delicious BBQ dinner. You'll be able to choose between steaks, Paella, burgers, etc. And in the morning, you can have breakfast at the hotel nearby. Twin Ring Motegi is located in Tochigi prefecture. From Tokyo it takes about 3 hours by train or bus. Take a train or Shinkansen (bullet train) to Utsunomiya Station, Mito Station or Motegi Station and change to a bus to reach Twin Ring Motegi.
strTitle: Go camping in style at Twin Ring Motegi in Tochigi

strIntroduction: This tour will take you to see the world-famous Snow Monkeys that reside in Jigokudani followed by a bicycle ride through the countryside. Your guide will meet you at Nagano Station at 8:45am. From Nagano Station, get taken to the Snow Monkey Park in Yudanaka. The region's snow monkeys are world-famous for their habit of soaking in hot springs during winter. These amazing macaques will let you get really close to them for some great photo opportunities. After saying goodbye to the snow monkeys, stroll along a forest trail to a nearby restaurant where you will enjoy lunch before heading off to the Japanese countryside and a historic hot spring town by bicycle. The route takes you mostly downhill through the Japanese countryside past rice paddies, apple orchards and rivers, as well as takes you to the old town of Shibu Onsen which has a history of over 1300 years with its hot springs. You will also have the chance to taste some local onsen town delicacies. You will learn about the history and culture of the region while riding your bike past rice paddies, orchards, and many more panoramic sights. The tour ends at Yudanaka Station where you can get the train back to Nagano Station or before getting on the train, take a relaxing foot bath for free! Tour itinerary: 08:45 Meet up at Nagano Station under the East Exit information board opposite of the Shinkansen exit. 10:00 Welcome to the Snow Monkey area! Walk for 30 minutes along a forest trail to the Snow Monkey Park where you get to enjoy the wild monkeys playing around. 12:15 Have delicious lunch nearby the Snow Monkey Park! 13:00 Leave the lunch restaurant and get ready to see the Japanese countryside on bicycle! 13:30 Start at the Snow Monkey Resorts Info & Gift Shop. 16:00 Arrive at the Yudanaka Station and get on the train back to Nagano. No need to cycle back up the hill. The train leaves from Yudanaka to Nagano Station at 16:43. (Finishing time may vary depending cycling speed, taking photos, etc.) 17:30 Arrival back to Nagano Station.
strTitle: Enjoy a one day Snow Monkey and Cycling Tour in Nagano

strIntroduction: Big sushi roll, "Futomaki", is a local specialty from Chiba. It's a treat during festivals and celebrations. It looks beautiful and tastes good. Learn how to make Futomaki sushi roll from a local dietitian who knows all about Japanese food and then eat a delicious Kaiseki meal. It takes about 1 and half hour of learning and an hour of meal time. For this experience, come to our restaurant in Chiba. It is about 5 minutes walk from JR Chiba Station. Kaiseki is traditional Japanese cuisine from the Edo period. Did you know that in Japan, we have not only 4, but 72 different seasons traditionally? We express the beauty of those seasons in our cuisine. Food is all organic, no additives are used. We think food makes your body healthier and we serve only good food for you. We also have Aikido experience, special kimono experience, sushi making experience, learning the manners of Kaiseki, and Japanese music instrument experience for you. Please, check them also from our profile. Thank you!
strTitle: Experience making a Big Sushi Roll and Kaiseki meal in Chiba

strIntroduction: Japan is one of the most earthquake prone countries in the world, but it might be difficult for tourists to imagine what you are supposed to do when an earthquake comes. This tour will help you learn how to survive when you face a giant earthquake. I will take you to the disaster museum and the shop in Ikebukuro to offer: <1> short animation movie to learn about the earthquake history in Japan <2> Fire fighting training (you will learn to use a fire extinguisher) and train escaping from smoke filled room <3> Experience a giant earthquake with an earthquake simulation machine <4> Visit a store to see latest disaster protection goods in Japan <5> My experience talking about Tohoku earthquake on March 11, 2011 Here is outline of this tour: ■When? 7days a week Starting time are 12:00 pm or 2:00 pm ■Where to meet up? Pick up at your hotel (Central of Tokyo only) or meet up at lobby of Hotel Metropolitan in Ikebukuro ■How long? 3.5 hours Looking forward to seeing you!
strTitle: Experience an Earthquake Survival Study Tour in Tokyo

strIntroduction: You will be met by a local tourist guide at Otaru Port and walk to downtown or at the lobby of your hotel. Downtown Otaru is laid out and is remarkably compact and walkable city, so that most of the tourist spots can be accessed on foot. When visiting one of the Herring Palaces, Otaru guest house or the observatory on Mt. Tengu, you are advised to take a city bus. The old Otaru Canal is one of the "musts" for visitors. There are stone warehouses on both sides of the picturesque canal. They are now turned into tourist facilities: restaurants, gift shops, museums, etc. Please enjoy strolling along the canal and have a relaxing time. Extra info: The city is close to Yoichi town, one of its neighboring communities well-known for its Nikka whiskey distillery, in which you can enjoy a tour in a beautiful distilling facility with Scottish atmosphere. Toward the end of tour you can even taste their products for free. Yoichi is also known as a fruit growing community, which offers cherry picking in summer and apple harvesting in autumn. You can visit it by city bus. Otaru can be visited from Sapporo city, the capital city of Hokkaido, by train in 30 minutes.
strTitle: Enjoy an Introduction Tour to Otaru, Hokkaido

strIntroduction: This is a group tour for up to 8 people. Below is the itinerary of the tour: 10:25: Meeting at Tsukiji Shijo Station (close to the main gate of Tsukiji Market) 10:30: Strolling the inner market, fish and seafood section - learn about Tsukiji, fish and seafood in general, or the best fish and seafood in all seasons - witness wonders you can see only in Tsukiji Market - mingle with the worker's colleagues 11:00: Strolling Uogashi-yokocho - visit some stores including a cooking knife store where the guide sometimes visits to buy or amend his shop's knives - try some snacks during the tour if you are hungry. We can find Japanese omelettes, a famous Japanese sweets shop (dango, Japanese dumpling) whose dango are favourite among Tsukiji's workers. 11:30: Namiyoke shrine - visit a special shrine for all Tuskiji workers. The guide bows every time he passes by. 11:40: Question time - please ask the guide whatever you want: about lunch spots or where to go during your stay! We want to help you as much as we can, like I was helped in many countries where I have traveled. 12:00: End of tour
strTitle: Take a quick Tsukiji tour guided by a Tsukiji market worker!

strIntroduction: I offer the exquisite Japanese cuisine and sushi course in one of the locally popular hideaway restaurants in Tsukiji, Tokyo. One English-speaking local will be included in this course as the chef and his wife are not English speakers. He/she will help deepen your dining experience. The chef is well informed about sake, Japanese distilled liquor (shochu), etc. Please dive into this profound Japanese cuisine world! Time & Date Mon - Fri: 18:00 - 22:00 Sat: 17:30 - 21:00 Meeting Point Tsukiji Station *or, we can arrange pick-up at another place according to your travel schedule (the transportation fee is not included) Schedule 17:30 - 19:00 meet up at Tsukiji Station 17:40 - 19:10 Japanese cuisine and sushi course starts You can stay there until the closing time. Menu Description The chef goes to Tsukiji Fish Market every day to choose the best vegetables, fish and seafood in the season. Unlike pre-made food chain store, the menu changes day by day. Before sushi, dishes for paring with sake are mainly served. =Below seasonal dishes are examples= *Every season -cream cheese pickled with Japanese sake leeks Japanese sake leeks deepen and make cream cheese more tasty, which is one of this restaurant's specialty. Enjoy the amazing combination with Japanese sake. *Winter only -foie gras of the sea, Ankimo (steamed Monkfish liver) Unlike foie gras, it is natural, good for heath, and full of nutrition. Sake and Ankimo make one of the best couples in Japan! :) NOTICE: * +16 year-old only * Please let me know if you have any allergies * Group tour (max. 8 people) * Raw fish and seafood (shrimp, clams etc) are included in this course. So I don't recommend this course for strict vegetarian * Any food request is welcome（Do you have any dietary restrictions like Halal? Please let me know） * Depending on the availability, this tour would not be held or I can recommend another local hideaway restaurant near Tsukiji * Meeting time will be fixed according to your schedule. Please contact us.
strTitle: Feel like a local at a secret hideaway restaurant in Tsukiji

strIntroduction: You can choose the game which you want to see out of the areas and teams listed below Areas: Osaka or Kyoto or Nagoya 1. Gamba Osaka Popular player is Usami Takashi who played in Bayern Munich 2. Cerezo Osaka Former team of Kagawa Shinji, Dortmund 3. Kyoto Sanga Former team of Pak Chi Song 4. Nagoya Grampus Former team of Keisuke Honda, AC Milan I will arrange the tickets for you and your accompany. We'll meet at the station which is near to your hotel or the stadium of the above teams. Then we will go to the stadium together. We'll have a stadium tour and buy some local goods. We'll eat the stadium special food. And before the game I'll briefly explain to you about the team and individual players. Furthermore, you will learn how to "cheer" during the game to root for the team. When the game starts, we will cheer with the core supporters in the audience. When we score a goal, we will high-touch and hug with local Japanese supporters. This will make you "united" with local Japanese people!
strTitle: Watch an exciting football game in Nagoya, Osaka or Kyoto!

strIntroduction: This is a cycling tour around the center of Tokyo by an electrical assist bike. It is comfortable and safe for women, children and elderly people. The remarkable point is that we provide you with a wearable video camera. After the tour, we will give you the videos. This would be a vivid memory of your trip to Japan. The tour concept is: 1. Enjoy the city area of Tokyo 2. Experience the nature of Tokyo 3. Get to know the local people's life of Tokyo. We will start from Shinjuku area, and go to Shinjuku Gyoen which is the largest park with lots of nature. At Shinjuku Gyoen we will have lunch. We will provide you with the lunch box, Japanese style, or sandwiches if you like. Before the tour, we will ask you if you prefer to eat at a restaurant. If so, we will take you to a meal set restaurant where local Japanese eat often. Then we will go to the east to Jingu Gaien area, where the Olympic Stadium is under construction. After that we will cycle around the Imperial Palace enjoying the nice news. We will pass the Marunouchi area. It is the center of business of Japan. Many famous companies have their offices there. In the Marunouchi area we will go to Masakado-zuka. It's the grave of Tairano Masakado who is thought to be the spiritual guardian of Tokyo according to some legends. Finally, we will visit Kanda area. It's an old area where you can enjoy the local culture of Tokyo. In total the tour will take 4 to 5 hours.
strTitle: Cycle around Tokyo with an electric bike and a camera

strIntroduction: We will hire a huge vehicle to carry the bikes, and will come to pick you up from your hotel in Nagoya. The car accommodates 6 bikes and 6 people maximum. We will reach Shinshiro city, where the beautiful Tanada (terraced rice fields) area is after an hour drive. It is included in the list of Japan's 100 Best terraced rice fields. We will go to top of the mountain, from where we bike down the slope and feel the wind! We will take pictures, of course. And we will give you a wearable camera. After the ride, we will download the video and send it to you as a memory from your trip. We will eat a lunch box during the tour, near the Tanada. On the way back to Nagoya, we will visit a hot spring (onsen). You can relax by soaking your body into the huge bathtub!
strTitle: One day cycling tour around terraced rice fields near Nagoya

strIntroduction: Takayama is one of the most popular places to visit in Japan. Many people visit Tokyo or Osaka, but Takayama is far away from those cities. The nearest terminal station where the Shinkansen bulle train stops is Nagoya Station. You will come to Nagoya by Shinkansen and we will come to pick you up from Nagoya Station. We will drive you to Takayama to see the natural scenic beauty of central Japan by a hired vehicle. After arriving at Takayama, we will tour around the city by walking, enjoying the traditional streets, temples, and shops. This will give you the feeling of exploring "little Kyoto". If you like, we can bring bikes with the vehicle. Then we will go to the mountain areas of Takayama and enjoy cycling with the bike down the hills. (Note: extra fee will apply for the bike rental) After enjoying Takayama, we will return back to Nagoya. On the way to Nagoya, we can visit a hot spring and relax. We can get to Nagoya Station by the evening. It will be possible for you to board a Shinkansen bullet train or go to your hotel.
strTitle: Walk or cycle around Takayama on a day tour from Nagoya

strIntroduction: In this reservation service, you will get an appointment in Nagoya, Aichi, and have the chance to experience a fashionable makeover of your nails! The latest art styles will decorate your fingers! Below is the itinerary of this activity: 1. Tell me your preferred date and time for this activity. The treatment takes about 3 hours for finger nails and toe nails. 2. I will make a reservation at a salon 3. I will pick you up wherever you like (within the center of Nagoya or your hotel). 4. You will have the chance to discuss and decide your nail designs with the nail designer. Don't worry, our staff will break the language barrier. 5. After the treatment, I can guide you to your next destination within the city. (Please note transportation expense will not be included.) ■Nail artist introduction (Nail artist: MEG) She presents creative designs in all aspects of fashion, including nails. She has been a pioneer in the Japanese nail industry, contributing to it since it started. Besides the management of one of the major nail salons in Japan, she is also a top nailist who has been responsible for the treatment of 200,000 customers. Furthermore, she concurrently serves as principal of a nailist school that has produced more than 2000 nailists. Besides appearing on a number of media such as TV and magazines, she has been receiving offers as a seminar lecturer from all over the world. ■Products I use No Damage products and all Japanese brands. Paragel is the latest nail technology that is created with the specific purpose of causing ZERO damage to your nails. No buffing is required so your nails can retain their 3 natural nail plates and therefore keep them healthy! This is compared to conventional gel nails which damage your natural nail due to buffing that damages the nail upon application and again upon removal! Unlike unconventional gel nails which will separate and discolor over time, Paragel retains its color! The LED light is used for only 30 seconds for quicker application! The Paragel itself is nail friendly and in fact acts as a fortifier to protect your nails. This is particularly recommended for ladies who paint their nails often. Please do not hesitate to ask me anything in advance!
strTitle: 60% OFF Visit a top nail salon in Nagoya, Aichi

strIntroduction: This course is about 2 hour long. Nail art is very popular in Japan. Both young and mature women enjoy gel nails. The number of people doing their own nails is increasing. The lecturer is a top manicurist with plenty of experience. You can pick a design from our design books to try for yourself. For more difficult art, our lecturer will be at hand to guide you along so that you can finish your design beautifully. All tools used are made in Japan. You can work with confidence using our quality products that do not damage the nail. We have also prepared our peel off base so that you can remove your nail art easily on your own. Details of the activity: 1. Please let us know your preferred date and timing. 2. On the day of the lesson, we will pick you up from your hotel (within Nagoya city). For those coming from outside of Nagoya we will pick you up from Nagoya Station. 3. Lesson will commence as soon as you arrive. All tools will be provided. 4. Our very experienced and professional nail lecturer will be at hand to help you out with difficult techniques.
strTitle: Enjoy learning nail technique in Nagoya, Aichi

strIntroduction: I will teach you Japanese with a conversation book. If you are a beginner, we will try to say greetings and small talk, then write your name or something else in Hiragana, Katakana or Kanji. If you want, the lesson will be focused on conversation only. At first, I will pick you up from your hotel (or Haneda airport is also ok. I will bring you from the airpot to the hotel you booked, then after check-in we will start lesson. However, additional fees apply for airport pick-up.) One lesson lasts 2 hours including picking time and going to the cafe. This lesson fee and all optional fee are per person. I will arrange the lesson depending on your interests, so if there is something you want to learn, don't hesitate to share with me please. *Optional* - pick up at Haneda airport and bring to your hotel (lesson time starts when we get to the hotel.) -lesson at a Japanese Izakaya bar (not at cafe) Lesson time is 3.5 hours including sending you off to the hotel. This Izakaya lesson is available only after 5 pm.
strTitle: Let's learn Japanese with coffee at a cafe in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: The workshop takes place inside a studio of professional drum players. We provide each participant with a happi (a Kimono jacket), which needs to be worn over a T-shirt. Because of this, participants are asked to bring a T-shirt to the class. We have changing rooms (one for men and the other for women) at the studio for your convenience. The workshop begins with a powerful performance of the wadaiko (traditional Japanese drum) by Koharu and her daughter Kinako. Koharu is a professional drummer with 20 years of experience and leads Izu Hakone Daiko Troupe. Following the lesson, Koharu and Kinako will provide you with a drum lesson. You will play a few different pieces of music, starting with a slow-tempo one that is easy to master. You need no experience with drums. Koharu and Kinako will take your hand and walk you through what to do. If you are looking to try more advanced-level songs, just ask the instructors, and they will be happy to show you how to play them. We want you to discover how exciting drumming can be. So, just bring your curiosity to the class and enjoy the feel of rush from drum beats. Following the drum session, you will have the chance to sit back and watch Kinako’s graceful Kimono dance (what’s called Nihon-buyo in Japanese, which is a traditional performance dance in the Kimono). Each workshop will basically have four participants in minimum. This means you will likely share a class with other international visitors on the day. However, please choose the booking option which corresponds to the size of your group. If you prefer a private lesson, just let us know, and we will be happy to arrange it with Koharu and Kinako. Please contact us for price information on private lessons.
strTitle: Japanese Drum Lesson & Kimono Dance Performance in Asakusa

strIntroduction: Enjoy jazz music performance with a glass of champagne or a healthy dinner only at COTTON CLUB at Marunouchi, Tokyo with special price! COTTON CLUB is originally from New York, and is the legendary venue that spawned such jazz legends as Duke Ellington, Cab Calloway, Lena Horne, and so many others. COTTON CLUB was a vibrant scene that saw celebrities and socialites gather nightly to enjoy cutting edge musical entertainment amid the backdrop of the prohibition of the 1920’s. The mission of COTTON CLUB Japan is to bring back a taste of the Golden Age of the original COTTON CLUB, and to recreate a social scene for adult fans. At COTTON CLUB Japan, you can enjoy many performances of visiting world-class artists regularly in an elegant, luxuriously appointed venue, topped off by a delicious menu of authentic cuisine. There are two courses available for this reservation service: 1. Music Charge (Non-reserved seats) + A glass of champagne 2. Music Charge (Non-reserved seats) + Healthy dinner course (Appetizers, fish dish, and desserts) Both of the course are available for 34 jazz performances, and you can book them at special price! Reservation is difficult to make, so we suggest you to use our reservation service for your convenience! Also, please tell us which jazz music performance that you would like to attend and we will try our best to reserve it for you!
strTitle: Enjoy Jazz Music with Champagne or Healthy Dinner in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: "Trampoland Tokyo" is a trampoline park located in Itabashi, Tokyo. Here you can release your stress and have fun jumping up and down on a huge trampoline with family and friends. As many theme parks these days are designed for children only, this is a place where adults, families and couples can all come out and have a great time. This theme park has become famous recently and has been featured in many magazines and on TV. First, participants take "Starter Lesson" to learn the basics of bouncing and how to conduct oneself on the trampoline. The instructor will teach you how to jump straight up, move your body in the air, and how to do a variety of drops. After the lesson, patrons are free to jump on the trampoline. Its 16m by 6m frame is large enough for everyone to enjoy the free space in their own style. Many past participants agreed that not only is it a lot of fun, but great training for our muscles. What a fun way to get a workout! Make sure to wear comfortable clothes so that you can fully enjoy the activity. Don’t miss this opportunity to experience such an interesting sport! Operating Hours: Every day (except Mondays) Weekdays: 14:00 - 22:30 Weekends and national holidays: 10:00 - 20:00
strTitle: Have an Amazing Trampoline Experience at Trampoland in Tokyo

strIntroduction: The "Laser Trap Room" is a unique and fun experience everyone can enjoy located in Harajuku, Tokyo. The concept is easy. All you have to do is push three buttons set up in a room in 90 seconds. The only problem is, the lasers are lit in complex patterns in front of you. You have to find the fastest, easiest and closest way to get to all the buttons! The key to the game is using your whole body, be sensitive to your surroundings and careful where you step! The "Laser Trap Room" has four levels: Beginner, Intermediate, Advanced and Professional. This special offer is the only one that gives you access to the "secret level." At each level, you can see how well you escaped and try to get the high score! Fun, adventurous and thrilling this is surely a great activity to do with family and friends. Private rooms for up to four people.
strTitle: Enjoy Laser Games in Harajuku, Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Fukushima has many beautiful hanami places. Many people from all around Japan visit Fukushima to see the cherry blossoms in full bloom. One of the most popular hanami spots is Hanamiyama, a park on the slopes surrounding a rural farming neighborhood just outside central Fukushima. Originally started by local farmers who planted ornamental plants and flowering trees on the hillsides around their land, the park was opened to the public in 1959 and has grown into the city's top cherry blossom spot. Every year thousands of visitors flock to the area to admire its cherry blossoms. The Miharu Takizakura is considered by many as the single most beautiful cherry tree in Japan. It is located in Miharu, a town in central Fukushima. "Takizakura" literally means "waterfall cherry tree" in Japanese; a fitting name as the 12 meter tall tree's wide drooping branches spread out over 20 meters east to west and 18 meters north to south, making it appear like a cascading waterfall. The tree is estimated to be over a thousand years old and its trunk has a girth of 9.5 meters. The trip departs in Tokyo and returns to Tokyo. Please wear comfortable clothes and shoes. The one-day bus tour itinerary is as follows: - Start at Hamamatsucho Station (7:30) - Lunch at Bandai Koriyama Ten - Hanamiyama Park - Miharu Takizakura - Come back to Tokyo Station (Around 21:00) * Lunch is included. * Free for infants ages 5 and under.
strTitle: Enjoy a One-Day Tour to Sakura Spots in Fukushima!

strIntroduction: Have you ever dreamed of becoming a pilot? We offer this unique opportunity to have your childhood dream come to life at JFlight! JFlight in Yokohama, Kanagawa, is a unique place where you can experience flight simulation. You can enjoy piloting your own flight in the high-quality reproduced cockpit of AirBus A320. Usually only staff members and pilots are allowed to enter here, so it's a rare chance to see what being a pilot would really be like. Upon entrance into JFlight, you will see a variety of plastic airplane models decorating your surroundings. You will then listen to instructions regarding the cockpit and how to handle your own flight. Inside the cockpit, you can feel the atmosphere of a real flight! Once you sit in the pilot seat, you will definitely feel the excitement as a huge screen in front of you shows a real, natural landscape. Experience takeoff and landing from popular airports such as Narita Airport and Haneda Airport. This is a place not only for children, but adults, too! You can have fun with your family and friends. Take some unforgettable pictures in the cockpit of your day as a pilot! JFlight Operating Hours: Every day 10:00 - 22:00 *You can make reservations for every 30-minute time block (e.g. 10:00, 10:30, 11:00 etc...) You can choose between 3 different plans, outlined below! 1. Basic flight (30 minutes) Capacity: 2 people Experience: 1 Flight 2. Advanced flight (60 minutes) Capacity: 4 people Experience: 2 Basic Flights, takeoff and landing 3. Kid’s flight (30 minutes) Ages: 7 – 12 Years old Capacity: 1 Person Experience: 15 minutes instruction, 15 minutes takeoff and landing
strTitle: Be a Pilot for a Day and Enjoy Flight Simulation in Yokohama

strIntroduction: Have you ever wore a robot suit? At Cyberdyne in Tsukuba, Ibaraki, you can! Cyberdyne is a robotic company focused on creating technology that can seamlessly coexist with people. Among their most notable inventions is a robot named HAL. It is the world's first cyborg-type robot as it enables, supports and enhances the wearer's body movements. It was designed to assists a physically challenged people to move freely, and enable him/her to exert bigger motor energy than usual. In this tour, you can actually try on this high-technology robot! The tour includes a 10-minute brief introductory talk about the company, Cyberdyne, then a short lesson about HAL's mechanism and how to wear it. Then you are actually going to wear HAL. Don't worry there will be an assistant who will take you through the whole process. Have fun with HAL enhancing your movements by sitting-down, standing-up, and walking around.
strTitle: Experience Japan's robot technology at Cyberdyne in Tsukuba!

This experience will make you feel strong for sure. Child of over 7 can attend. The experience takes about 1 and half hour. The meal will take about an hour. strIntroduction: Kado, the flower arrangement experience, takes about an hour. The meal also will take about an hour. You don't need anything to bring but you might get wet. Do not dress up with clothes that you wouldn't want to get wet. The concept of beauty in Japan is very unique and exotic. Learning and feeling the beauty will refinde your delicate sense. The master will guide you through the most mysterious Japanese art by using flower arrangement. This experience starts from 11:00 am. For this experience, come to our restaurant in Chiba. It is about 5 minutes walk from JR Chiba Station. Kado is easy to try with good instructions from a master. You will be able to do flower arrangement in our room in Japanese way. Kaiseki is traditional Japanese cuisine from the Edo period. Did you know that in Japan, we have not only 4, but 72 different seasons traditionally? We express the beauty of those seasons in our cuisine. Food is all organic, no additives are used. We think food makes your body healthier and we serve only good food for you. We also have calligraphy experience, tea ceremony experience, special kimono experience, sushi making experience, learning the manners of Kaiseki, and Japanese music instrument experience for you. Please, check them also from our profile. Thank you!
strTitle: Experience Flower Arrangement and Kaiseki meal in Chiba

strIntroduction: The Seto Inland Sea, or simply the Setouchi, is a peaceful inland sea known as a kayaking paradise. The unique granite shoreline and off-shore islands always offer a great day of discoveries and adventure! If conditions permit, you can explore sea caves that can be approached by kayaks only. We will stop for a break or lunch at one of the local bays enjoying the peace and tranquility of this remote location. Take a walk to the highest point of the island where you can see and feel the primitive and spiritual aspect of the Japanese. A giant granite rock with a phallic outlook has been an object of worship as a symbol of family prosperity. + No previous kayaking experience is required. + We use stable double kayaks. + We require a minimum of 2 people for the tour. Choose between a full day or a half day kayaking tour. Itinerary for the full day tour: 9:50 Check in and meet your guide. 10:00 Kayak briefing. 10:30 Kayak from our base. Total kayak time is approximately 4.5 hours with breaks. 12:00 Enjoy lunch on a secluded beach of Tsutajima Island. 16:00 Arrive back to the base. Itinerary for the half day tour: 12:50 Check in and meet your guide. 13:00 Kayak briefing. 13:30 Kayak from our base. 14:30 Enjoy a tea break on a secluded beach of Tsutajima Island. 16:00 Arrive back to the base. This itinerary is an outline only. Your guide may decide to alter this program based on their judgement of weather, sea conditions, client ability and their fitness level. All trips are subject to having sufficient numbers and suitable weather conditions. Please refer to terms and conditions before you make a reservation. Our tour base in Nio, Kagawa prefecture, is facing to the beach where you set out your kayaking or SUP trips. Our base is a traditional Japanese folk house and we have all-necessary facilities; hot shower on site, toilets and luggage storage. Clients can use them without additional cost. Please park your car at Sun Resort NIO car park, just one minute walk away from our base. Need a transport? If you are a small group(2-4 people), ask us about free pick-up from JR Takuma Station, the closest railway station. NOTE:Bad weather may have an effect on the start of your tour, or it may occur during the tour. We reserve the right to cancel trips or alter schedules if weather conditions are not suitable for group safety. If we consider sea or weather conditions to be too difficult or unsafe, we do not launch the kayaks. We basically make a judgement at the time of 7:00 (for morning tours), 11:00 (for afternoon tours) and 2 hours prior to sunset trips on the date you have reserved. Then we contact you by using phone to explain about the condition. Therefore, please let us know an accessible number for urgent communication. Only when we know that the running of the tour is obviously difficult beforehand such as typhoons we contact you as soon as we decide cancellation.
strTitle: Embark on a Sea Kayaking Adventure in the Seto Inland Sea!

strIntroduction: This is a rare opportunity to experience the Japanese stage art Rakugo in English during your visit to Osaka! Rakugo is verbal entertainment with a storyteller and comic stories, popular among Japanese people and with a history of over 400 years. In this activity you can enjoy the art of Rakugo in English and even become a stage actor for an hour! Below is a greeting message from the Rakugo artists and instructor who will lead you to the wonderful world of Japanese comedy art: Hi, I am Sayohime, an English Rakugo performer! Rakugo is one of the traditional Japanese performing arts. It's a sit-down comic monologue with a history of over 400 years. I have been performing Rakugo in English not only in Japan but also in foreign countries since 2002. My English Rakugo class is located in an education center in Umeda, Osaka, one of Osaka’s most convenient areas. (5 min. walk from JR Osaka station) My goal is to provide a Rakugo experience in English and follow the motto “Humor is universal”. My 60-min.class includes: 1. Introduction and demonstration about Rakugo history, Rakugo rules (12 min.) 2. Sayohime’s English Rakugo performance (20 min) 3. Your English Rakugo performance on the stage You will become a Rakugo performer at the end of the class. I would be happy to answer any questions after the class. Time slots available: 3:30 pm - 4:30 pm 4:45 pm - 5:45 pm Only on the the first and third Thursday of the month. Let's have fun together and perform Rakugo!
strTitle: Experience sit-down comedy Rakugo in English in Osaka!

strIntroduction: The calligraphy experience takes about 1 and half hour. The meal will take about an hour. You don't need anything to bring but you might get dirty with ink. Do not dress up with clothes that you wouldn't want to get dirty. Choose the starting time when you book: 10:30 for lunch or 17:00 for dinner. For this experience, come to our restaurant in Chiba. It is about 5 minutes walk from JR Chiba Station. Calligraphy is easy to try with good instructions from a master. You will be able to draw your name in Japanese characters. Kaiseki is traditional Japanese cuisine from the Edo period. Did you know that in Japan, we have not only 4, but 72 different seasons traditionally? We express the beauty of those seasons in our cuisine. Food is all organic, no additives are used. We think food makes your body healthier and we serve only good food for you. We also have tea ceremony experience, special kimono experience, sushi making experience, learning the manners of Kaiseki, and Japanese music instrument experience for you. Please, check them also from our profile. Thank you!
strTitle: Experience Calligraphy and Kaiseki meal in Chiba

strIntroduction: Spring in Japan comes together with cherry blossoms and it lasts only for a few weeks, so this is a rare time for visitors to pay a visit to all the most magnificent sakura view spots all over the country, of which worth mentioning is the Taki-sakura of Miharu - known as "the number one sakura tree in Japan". It is a 1000 year-old weeping higan tree, turning into a giant light pink waterfall during its blooming peak. It is classified as one of the five great cherry trees of Japan (日本五大桜) and one of the three giant cherry trees of Japan (日本三巨大桜). It was designated a national treasure in 1922. Begin the tour from the meeting point of either Shinjuku or Ueno and go by bus to Hanamiyama park where you can enjoy the view of different types of flowers in spring, from a vast scene of cherry blossoms to golden bell flowers and Japanese quince, etc. After that, the tour moves to the highlight of the day, the 1000 year-old Taki-sakura of Miharu! Here tourists can spend some time to admire this natural beauty then enjoy some shopping and wrap up the tour before returning back to Tokyo.
strTitle: Visit a 1000 year-old sakura tree in North Japan!

strIntroduction: This tour is available for guests of at least 6 years of age. Reservation must be completed at least 5 days prior the tour date. This tour is available every day, even on rainy days. The rickshaw has a roof as well as side windows and waterproof cover to keep you dry (days of non-operation may occur due to extreme circumstances, such as earthquakes, typhoons, etc.) A maximum of 2 people can ride one rickshaw. The rickshaw route can and may be customized depending on your interests. Drop-off service is available for the following locations: Kaminarimon, Asakusa Station, Tokyo Skytree. After the rickshaw ride in Asakusa are free to explore Asakusa for the day in your kimono. Please keep in mind that the kimono studio closes at 5 pm and that you will need to return the rented kimono by that time. In case you would like to wear the kimono for an entire day, we strongly recommend to come and get changed early. When making the booking, please indicate your preferred starting time between 10 am and 2 pm through the messaging system. Important! Expecting mothers in their first 16 weeks of pregnancy are not permitted to ride the rickshaw! Also, the ride is not recommended for babies under six months old.
strTitle: Enjoy Rickshaw Tour with Kimono Dressing in Tokyo

strIntroduction: In this tour you will dress in Japanese kimono and visit some famous sightseeing places in Tokyo recommended by the guide! Here is a list of places that I will take you to: - Asakusa. You can change into Kimono and experience traditional Japanese fashion. You might want to take pictures. After changing your clothes, you can walk and eat at Nakamise street which looks like old Tokyo from the Edo period. If you want, you can pull a good luck charm called Omikuji at Sensoji Temple. This is the best spot if you like the image of old Japan. - Ueno Park. It's a cultural mecca with a number of museums including the prestigious Tokyo National Museum and the delightful Shitamachi Museum with its display of old Tokyo. Here you'll find also Japan's oldest zoo - Ueno Zoo - and many galleries. We will also go around Shinobazu Pond and around the park. - Shibuya. Here is the most famous scramble intersection. You can visit many attractive shops. - Izakaya "Watami" (bring cash with you). This is a Japanese bar called Izakaya. You can spend great time here. We promise you reasonable prices. Izakaya is a Japanese-style pub popular among working people, which offers a variety of foods.
strTitle: Wear a kimono while strolling around famous spots in Tokyo

strIntroduction: In our professional singing class we offer you a completely personalized learning experience. We can teach you to sing any song you like. Our teachers are highly skilled at preparing chords charts from Youtube or CDs. This will be a great memory from your trip. You can practice: ・Vocal・Singing & Playing piano ・Piano only Teachers: Anne (vocal) Mari (vocal, singing & playing piano) Oyakata (singing & playing piano, Piano only) Private lesson or a small group : 1-10 people Our studio is new, clean, completely sound-proof YAMAHA Piano studio. 1 lesson takes about 60 minutes. The classes are offered on the following days between 2 p.m. and 7 p.m.: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Friday, Saturday.
strTitle: Sing Japanese songs on a singing lesson in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Endoji Shotengai Shopping arcade is the oldest shopping street in Nagoya, that hosts yearly Tanabata Festival. It is located about 10 minutes walking distance from both Nagoya Station and Nagoya castle. During this year's Endoji Shotengai's Tanabata Festival held from 27th to 31st of July we will have two guests (a pair or two single travelers) stay at Nishiasahi for two nights and have them help us finalize Nishiasahi's haribote (the big ornament hung on the ceiling of the roof of the street) the night before the festival starts. We also add some program and meal service! Itinerary: Day1. July 26th Arrive at Nishiasahi. Check in any time after 3 pm (luggage can be brought anytime after 10 am) 4:00 PM: Endoji Shotengai guided tour (1.5 hr) 7:00 PM: Dinner at Nishiasahi and free Beer Sometime in the night finalizing Haribote work (Tanabata festival decorations) Day2. July 27th Between 8 am to 10 am: Breakfast (onigiri, coffee, and scone) Free time @ Tanabata Festival Day3. July 28th Checkout by 11 am Enjoy the second day of Tanabata Festival! This tour is available only for 2 participants for now, but feel free to send us a message for more availability!
strTitle: Participate in Endoji Shotengai Tanabata Festival with Stay

strIntroduction: While Japan is renowned around the world for its healthy, unique, and delicious cuisine, it is not all about elegant and pricey sushi or the nurture-balance meal set at home. Just like in any country in the world, Japanese street food has become an increasingly popular way for people to learn about its rich culture. Let's begin our food journey in the evening at the street vendors often seen in every corner of this city, starting at the Yakitori Alley near Yurakucho. Yakitori is bite-sized pieces of chicken skewered on a bamboo skewer, barbecued over a charcoal grill and dipped into a special sauce. Try a sample portion accompanied with sake or local beer while listening to the guide explain the history of this popular snack food. Next, head to Monja Street in Tsukishima where you can enjoy the food while watching how the famous monjayaki is made. Monjayaki is a Japanese pan-fried batter with various choices of chopped ingredients such as vegetables, fish or chicken on top. The food tour cannot be complete without a dessert, let's have a try of wagashi - famous Japanese sweets mainly made from rice powder and red beans, but comes in such a wide range of shape and size, representing the infinite creativity and the love for beauty of Japanese people. Take a bite on Taiyaki - Japanese fish-shaped cake, with the most common filling is red bean paste made from sweetened azuki beans. By the end of the tour, please feel free to discover the night life of Tokyo by getting into some local restaurants, bars or clubs with our useful guide and tips.
strTitle: Go on a street food tour around Tokyo by night!

strIntroduction: Well-known for the diversified mix of the ancient and modern, old and new, travelling around Tokyo is a chance to leap through time to see how much this artful culture has changed. Each part of this city contains epic pieces of architectural revolution, from working buildings to the most colourful shopping centers of the country. To begin the tour, first you can visit the futuristic aluminum-clad Fuji Sankei Building in Odaiba, here you can admire the bird-eye view of the city from the 7th floor, 32 diameter sphere. Then, dive into the most luxurious and effulgent atmosphere in Ginza area, visiting all remarkable international brands such as Hermes, Louis Vuitton, Christian Dior whose houses not only full of trendy fashion but also can amaze visitor by their design structures. After taking a look at the renowned earthquake-resistant Shiseido Ginza and enjoy all the looks, let's enjoy a decent meal in a stylish restaurant in this area and have some free time for shopping and strolling around Harajuku. In the afternoon, the tour moves and ends at the International Forum in Marunouchi - a significant landmark for its distinct internal and external design. After the tour, please feel free to wander around the neighbourhood to get to know more about the impressive and appreciative architecture in this city.
strTitle: Discover East Tokyo on an architectural tour!

strIntroduction: With the mix of traditional and modern taste especially in architect, Tokyo is a must-explore place for those attracted to this art. Iconic and unique modern architecture as well as the most inventive and inspirational buildings in the West side of Tokyo are all featured in this 6-hour walking tour. By joining the tour, you can not only visit all the spotlighted structures but also learn the stories behind from our passionate and experienced guide - how they revolutionized through time into such eye-pleasing spots as seen today. After gathering at the meeting point, the tour begins at Daikanyama T-site, walking through the white lattice upscale retail complex most known with on of the most beautiful bookstores in town. Continue to the egg-shaped Shibuya Station, take your time to listen to the motivation behind these structures, how they were conceived and built. After that, stroll along to the most luxurious fashion corner in Omotesando with all the international design houses of Prada or Christian Dior, having lunch at a stylish restaurant here, enjoy the zelkova tree-lined avenue and take a look at the quirky yet trendy youth fashion and art in Harajuku. The tour wraps up by visiting the National Art Center and 21-21 design site reminiscent to Japanese origami.
strTitle: Discover an amazing architectural tour in West Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Whether drawn into the deep-rooted traditional culture of Tokyo or have a soft spot for its unique architecture, this tour is just for you! For a dash of the rich history embedded in the ancient works, as well as the unique contemporary culture as represented in the youth fashion, on this tour, you can have a chance to get access to the diverse style of Tokyo city. First, after meeting up at the designated location, the tour will start at Meiji Jingu Shrine. Here you can learn about the traditional Japanese architecture and how much influence it has on the modern style. Continue to Harajuku, and you can delve yourselves into the unique youth culture of Tokyo by visiting fashion boutiques and trendy cafés there before moving to Omotesando, where you can see the grand structures of luxurious brands such as Louis Vuitton, Dior and Prada. Finally, the tour ends at Minoru Mori Tower, Roppongi Hills. Here you can have a good comparison with the traditional Japanese architecture by visiting the district full of towering offices, apartments, modern restaurants and hotels; there you can also learn about the philosophy behind postmodern art movements as demonstrated by Takashi Murakami - an internationally well-known contemporary artist, visit the work of Tadao Ando at 21-21 Design Sight, and end the tour by looking through the 54-story Mori Tower.
strTitle: Join a very interesting Art & Architectural tour in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Have an amazing experience in our private/ small group (4 persons max) tour! ・Half day tour 1 pm: pick up from Tsukuba Station 1:45pm: Visit Mt. Tsukuba Shrine 2:30pm: Inaba Shuzou brewety tour - Tour inside the brewety - Meet our female brewer - Sake tasting (3 different sake set) (about an hour and a half) 4:00 pm: Return to the station and end of tour ・1 day tour 9 am: pick up from Tsukuba Station 9:45 am: Visit Mt. Tsukuba Shrine 10:00 am: Hike to top of the mountain (about 90min) 12:00 pm: Take the mountain cablecar back to the Shrine 12:15 pm: Lunch break (lunch fee is not included) 1 pm: pick up from Tsukuba Station 1:45 pm: Visit Mt. Tsukuba Shrine 2:30 pm: Inaba Shuzou brewery tour - Tour inside the brewery - Meet our female brewer - Sake tasting (3 different sake set) (about an hour and a half) 4:00 pm: Return to the station and end of tour You can also book the tours with the special add-on photo service. Photo service: half day tour 1,000 JPY (30-50 photos, 10 edited photos) 1 day tour 2,000 JPY (50-80 photos, 30 edited photos) all in high resolution. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ About me: I'm Misaki, and I'm from Japan. I am a travel lover, and have been to more than 10 counties and have lived in California, Vietnam and Cambodia before. Since my family owns a 150-years-old Sake brewery in Tsukuba, which is just an hour away from Tokyo, I would like to host Sake brewery tour to those who are interested in experiencing Japanese traditional culture during your stay in Japan! About Inaba Shuzou (稲葉酒造): We have been brewing Sake called "Minanogawa (男女川)" since Edo era at the foot of Mt. Tsukuba, surrounded by fresh air and blessing well water in our backyard. Minanogawa is a name of the river flowing in the center of the mountain. Mt. Tsukuba itself is known for being a spiritual power spot and the nature is still well preserved. In the middle of Mt. Tuskuba, there's a shrine and we have been offering our sake since the beginning of our brewery. My mom succeeded the family brewery when she was 35 years old and became a touji (master sake brewer) of Inaba Shuzou. A female sake brewer is very rare in Japan! Our brewery is very small, and still keeps the original building; it has mud wall and thick tree pillars, not only that, but we still keep the traditional handcraft way to brew the authentic sake. Please come through Inaba Shuzou and taste the non-machinery, addictive free, REAL Sake! Tsukuba: 45 min by Tsukuba Express from Akihabara (1,150 JPY). Pick up from the station. 4 persons max a day. Price: per person. ※If you include kids or underage person, please let me know in advance.
strTitle: Tour a 150-year-old Sake Brewery and/or Hike Mt Tsukuba

strIntroduction: Enjoy an exclusive tour through the rich and historical city of Kyoto. A maximum of 12 people can attend this tour, so you will really feel the atmosphere of this traditional city with a knowledgeable and English-speaking guide, You will start your tour at one of the city's must-see hot spots: Tōfukuji Temple, which was built in the 13th century. Admire how the elements of the earth, sand, rock and moss come together to create natural and beautiful art. Contemplate the purpose of Zen from a shaded and serene spot and imagine what it must have been like in the 13th century where others stood where you stand now. Learn about the origin and inspiration for the garden, and what it means to the Monks who continue to live and study here. Next, you will head to Fushimi Inari Shrine, nestled at the base of the tree-covered mountainside. Count the numerous fox statues, which are considered messengers of the Gods. Pass through the winding red torii gates that stretch for miles up the mountain. Finally, at twilight, head towards the twinkling lights of Gion. This is Kyoto's gathering spot for Geisha and features many historic and traditional restaurants, tea houses and theaters. These are all combined with Japan's traditional architecture and ancient Kyoto entertainment. Keep an eye out for a flash for white make up or an elaborate up do, you may just see a rare and beautiful Geisha rushing by.
strTitle: Walk Through Traditional City of Kyoto with English Guide!

strIntroduction: Tokyo may be known as a modern metropolis, but did you know that there are many historical places hidden within its city walls? Tokyo's diverse aspects keep tourists from all ages and backgrounds coming back every year, and little bits of history can be found around every corner. Experience the mysteries of Tokyo starting in the district of Ningyocho which is known for its ancient traditions and tasty treats. Your first stop is a shop that specializes in Japanese sweets, dating back to the 19th century. Your next stop will be an incense store that has been around since 1705. Here, you will learn about "kodo" traditional Japanese incense ceremony. Nearby is a traditional Japanese snack shop where you can try many candies that were popular in the early 20th century. These include candies, caramels, Japanese ramune soda, fish jerky and snacks made with bean paste. Across the street is a "shamisen" shop. This is a traditional Japanese instrument used for many ceremonies and performances. After a visit to a local "tengui" shop, which are traditional Japanese hand towels, you will visit one of the eight temples located in Ningyocho. After that, you will visit a shrine on your way to Nihonbashi, a hub for merchants since the Edo period. Here, you will visit a seaweed shop, an old-fashioned stationery shop and a toothpick shop that has been in business since 1704. Last, you'll visit a shop that makes incredibly thin golden leaves that have been traditionally used for decorating ceramics. Finally, your tour will end at the Nihonbashi information center, where you can get a few more traditional Japanese sweets. As you can see, these little gems of Tokyo have roots in great Japanese traditional culture. Come and talk a walk through these historical districts and enjoy your stay in Tokyo! ※The starting time is 12:45 pm.
strTitle: Take a Walking Tour Through Traditional Spots in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: This is a special spring tour in which you will visit some of Japan's most famous sakura cherry blossom spots that can be seen in Miyagi prefecture, Tohoku. There is no better tour to feel the coming of the spring season! About the places included in the tour: 1. Ogawara's Thousand Sakura Trees at Funaoka Park This place is included in the selection of Japan's Best 100 cherry blossom spots. The sakura trees growing along the river have been planted in 1923. There are 1000 trees and the cherry blossoms in spring have become the symbol of the local town. During the sakura festival in April many food stalls are open. The park becomes lively with many visitors, and some of the attractions to try are a boat cruise on the river and a trip with a rickshaw. 2. Hotel Matsushima Onsen Ichinobo This hotel will impress you with its luxurious interior and an open-air hot spring pool overlooking the ocean. 3. Matsushima Bay: Zuiganji Temple, Entsuin Temple, Godaido Hall, Kanrantei tea house Enjoy strolling around the scenic Matsushima Bay and discover several famous temples from the era of the local feudal lord Date Masamune. You can also experience copying sutra, hands-on activities, grean tea, as well as eating delicious local seafood. Below is the itinerary for this relaxing tour to the countryside towns: Day 1 8:20 - Take Shinkansen Hayabusa 5 from Tokyo to Sendai Station, and then change to the local JR Tohoku line bound for Shiroishi until you reach Ogawara Station. Get off at Ogawara Station. 10:36 - Walk around the town and see the park of thousand sakura trees. Enjoy the sakura festival by a river boat or a rickshaw ride. Have lunch at the food stalls. 14:15 - Take the train from Ogawara Station to Sendai Station and then change to the local JR Senseki line for Matushima Kaigan Station. Get off at Matsushima Kaigan Station and get picked up by a shuttle bus to your hotel. Check in at Hotel Matsushima Onsen Ichinobo which will impress you with its luxurious interior and an open-air hot spring pool overlooking the ocean. Day 2 9:30 - Get picked up from the hotel and go to Matsushima seaside area to explore the town's historical wonders on foot: the gorgeous temples Zuiganji and Entsuin, which have attractive Japanese-style gardens, the Buddhist relic Godaido Hall, the tea house Kanrantei and much more! Enjoy hands-on activities and eat fresh seafood for lunch. You can leave your luggage at the station's coin lockers during sightseeing. 16:21 - Go to Matsushima-Kaigan Station where the tour ends. Recommended return trip to Tokyo: take the local train departing at 16:21 from Matsushima-Kaigan Station and arrive at Sendai at 16:49. Then take the Shinkansen bullet train at 17:09 and arrive in Tokyo at 18:52. Accommodation and meals (1 lunch on Day 2, 1 dinner, 1 breakfast) are included. This is a private tour specially for you. This is a specially designed tour that you can book only with us. You will not find this tour at any other travel company. Try it as a 2-day trip during your visit in Japan and discover hidden beautiful places that do no appear in standard guide books and travel packages. This tour is available only between April 7 and April 21.
strTitle: Visit famous sakura cherry blossom spots in Miyagi in 2 days

strIntroduction: This program offers a complete health-care package for women at Ruriko Tsushima Ladies Life Clinic Ginza. The package includes basic medical check up for women and Myers' high-dose intravenous vitamin c drip at reasonable price, specially designated for female tourists in their 20s - 40s who are having short stay in Japan. strTitle: Reserve a Complete Health-care Package for Women in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: This tour offers you round-trip bullet train Shinkansen tickets departing from Tokyo to Nagoya and one night accommodation at Nagoya's hotel. We recommend you to depart from Tokyo by bullet train Shinkansen to Nagoya in the morning, so you will have more time to spend in Nagoya to visit and explore Nagoya's famous sightseeing spots. We also recommend you to visit Sakae at night, where you can find many Nagoya's local food and shops. For the second day, we suggest you to take the bullet train Shinkansen in the afternoon so you will have more time to spend in Nagoya. Some of Nagoya Hotels available to book are as follows: - The B Nagoya - Unizo Inn Nagoya Higashi Sakae - Chisun Inn Nagoya - Hotel Wing International Nagoya - Princess Garden Hotel - Etc We will inform you which hotel is available after you make your reservation. Some famous sightseeing spots for Nagoya are as follows: - Atsuta Shrine The Atsuta Shrine, is considered as the most important Shinto shrine in Japan, was established in 1st Century AD and is famous for its preserved Imperial insignia, the "grass-mowing sword" (kusanagi-no-tsurugi), one of only three in the country. - Nagoya Castle Nagoya Castle was completely rebuilt in 1959 and remains one of the city's most important (and visited) landmarks. -Meiji Village Meiji-mura Village Museum in Inuyama is an open-air museum featuring many fine examples of Japanese architecture from the Meiji period of 1868 to 1912.
strTitle: Round-trip bullet train ticket and one night stay in Nagoya!

strIntroduction: This tour offers you round-trip bullet train Shinkansen tickets departing from Tokyo to Osaka and one night accommodation at Osaka's hotel. We recommend you to depart from Tokyo by bullet train Shinkansen to Osaka in the morning, so you will have more time to spend in Osaka to visit and explore Osaka's famous sightseeing spots. We also recommend you to visit Namba and Dotonbori at night, where you can find many Osaka's local food and shops. For the second day, we suggest you to take the bullet train Shinkansen in the afternoon so you will have more time to spend in Osaka. Some of Osaka Hotels available to book are as follows: - Osaka Garden Palace - Hotel NCB - Hotel Plaza Osaka - Hotel Hokkei Club Osaka - Shin-Osaka Esaka Tokyu Rei Hotel - Etc We will inform you which hotel is available after you make your reservation. Some famous sightseeing spots for Osaka are as follows: - Osaka Castle Osaka Castle is a more recent replication of the original castle built in the 1580s. It exhibits Osaka's pas with impressive stone walls, elegant gold-leaf trim and copper roofing. An observatory is perched atop the eight-story keep, making it a great place for panoramic views of the surrounding area. - Osaka Aquarium Kaiyukan Featuring the largest aquarium tank in the world, Osaka Aquarium displays a breathtaking view of aquatic life. Favorites among the 15 natural habitats and 35,000 specimens are the Japanese Forest, whale shark, Arctic penguins and giant spider crab. -Shitennoji Temple The Shitennoji Temple site is the oldest in Japan, with the original temple being constructed in 593. Surrounding the temple are lush grounds including a serene Japanese landscape garden replete with manicured shrubbery, streams and waterfalls. - Umeda Sky Building Enjoy panoramic views of Osaka from the 39th floor of this innovative observatory in one of the city's most modern architectural structures. Make a reservation for this tour and enjoy exploring the history and the culture of Osaka!
strTitle: Round-trip bullet train ticket and one night stay in Osaka!

Some famous sightseeing spots for Kyoto are as follows: - Kinkakuji Temple Kinkakuji, the famed “Golden Pavilion,” is Kyoto’s most iconic sight, rising above its reflecting pond like an apparition, - Ginkakuji Temple Ginkakuji temple, the “Silver Pavilion”, has magnificent halls and gardens, with a tremendous viewpoint over the entire temple compound - Kiyomizu-dera Temple Kiyomizu-dera Temple is one of Kyoto’s must-see attractions. It’s a bustling riot of commerce and schlock, but it’s a lot of fun, especially for the kids. - Nijo Castle Nijo Castle is one of Kyoto’s most popular and impressive sights. It shows the power that the Shoguns wielded over the emperors throughout the Edo Period Make a reservation for this tour and enjoy exploring the history and the culture of Kyoto!
